alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Kenosha; Racine; Walworth; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 11:11PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Walworth, western Racine, southern Waukesha, southeastern Jefferson and west central Kenosha Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1111 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Palmyra to near Browns Lake to near Round Lake. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waukesha, New Berlin, Muskego, Whitewater, Elkhorn, Delavan, Lake Geneva, Mukwonago, East Troy, Wales, Wind Lake, Vernon, Ottawa, Rochester, Dousman, North Prairie, Palmyra, Big Bend, Browns Lake, and Waterford North. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 320 and 331. Wisconsin Highway 26 near mile marker 32. Interstate 43 between mile markers 23 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
